review:
"Tompi Jones" is a fun old style platform game in 2.5D where you will help Tompi across six worlds: the Aztec Pyramid, the Enchanted Forest, the Kingdom of Arkan, the Mysterious Jungle, the Dark Cemetery and the Fortress of Edom.

Tompi can walk, jump, roll on the ground, he can plan with the propeller he has in his hat, throw many types of projectile weapons, defend himself with a shield, fight with a sword, use a jetpack, climb the lianas, cling to ceilings, climb walls and jump between walls.

He can also use special items as stop the time, become invisible, super speed, enhance his projectile weapons or use the invulnerability.

Collect all the secret pieces and coins scattered throughout the levels to improve your skills, and to buy and improve your weapons and special items.

The game has an Online World Ranking. If you get enough coins you will be in the top 50!.

review:
During my 15min of playtime I had:
2 crashes
1 case of respawning on top of a deathtrap repeatedly, causing a death loop (this is a game with fixed checkpoints, there's no excuse for this)
1 case of managing to go outside the level
1 case of sounds "stacking" and repeating after a death, with each loop of the sound adding yet another instance of it, with a slight delay
1 case of the camera borking out, giving me a constant zoomed in view of my character, with the camera being placed slightly above him, pointing diagonally down (this is a side-scrolling platformer, why is this even happening?)

And also, to just put a cherry on top of this mess, the music does not loop properly, and the UI is awful. 

The sad part is that it feels like the developers were actually trying to make something good here, they put a fare bit of effort into some elements of it, by the looks of it. They just did not have the know-how to actually create what they set out to create.

review:
Tompi is a fine example of a diamond in the rough - the two developers behind this game have added a lot more gameplay and exploration elements than most larger dev teams have over the past decade.

Secrets, collectibles, multiple gameplay mechanics; "AMBITIOUS" sums this game up nicely

But unfortunately Tompi met with a couple of highly aggrivating misfortunes along the way - namely lost data due to hard drive failure and a bundle site (now shut down) that refused to pay up for Tompi's participation.

I've just had a go since Desura and quite a bit has changed in the first level so I'm happy to see the game was cleaned up a bit more before it was deemed a closed case.

The developer assured me that, despite the bugs, all stages are finishable right up to end credits so I look forward to playing this game through to finish.

At the current retail I recommend this game to anyone wanting to support a small team of two who have tried desperatley hard and have churned out some highly intriguing game concepts (also see 'Match 3 Revolution') that perhaps might prove more lucrative if sold as concepts & prototypes to larger design houses.

author: {'steamid': '76561197985969658', 'num_games_owned': 1012, 'num_reviews': 690, 'playtime_forever': 15, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 15, 'last_played': 1441872509}
review:
3/10. 

If this game didn't exist the world would be a better place. It's a platformer that fails at every part of platforming. The same annoying song plays throughout the whole game. Trying to use a gamepad doesn't work because your guy just continually runs forward. Using keyboard/mouse, controls are terrible, with L mouse jumping, even though it says space does it. Only 2 preset config, can't set your own. The levels are boring, bland, and uninteresting. The graphics are terrible, not in a retro or pixel way, but in a blocky ugly poopy way. The actual platforming mechanics are terrible. The jump super inaccurately and floaty like. Your wall jumps are incontrollable. When you try and use the jetpack you  lag down quickly but only ascend slowly, and its hard to control. The combat is just you spamming attack to throw knives, but it doesn't really work. You can only throw straight forward but there are enemies that attack you from above and below meaning you get hurt a lot. There are a certain number of lives, and then continues. If you want to buy more the has a shop that links to their website.....because this is F2P now or what?
 
Look everywhere and anywhere else besides this game to fulfill your platforming needs. The $2 price tag is way too rich, 20 cents sounds more reasonable.

review:
First off I should apologize for not playing at least 2-3 hours on the game before reviewing.  30 min (or so) in and I've got to make dinner.  That said the last 29 min (or so) has been frustrating.

Good:
In bundles
Low system specs needed
May get steam cards (not as August 8th 2015)
Dev is (was) very helpful

Con:
Graphic options
Controls are not percise enough for us old guys / non-super twitch level gamers
Price (4.49 CDN) - wait to get this in a bundle
Graphics

Overall:
5/10 -2 controls -1 graphics -1 price +2 Dev = 3/10 (4/10 if in a bundle)

So yet another thumbs sideways game.  I'm not into scrollers, so that may be affecting my decision.  I'm OK with crappy graphics if the game is fun.  I'm not OK with crappy controls and I just cannot get the hang of the controls with enough percision to have fun.

If I come back to this game and they have improved the controls then I will re-review ... as I do want to like the game.  For now, I'm just frustrated.  Not fun = Thumbs down.
